newsitem.title: USA: Comptek unit gets contracts worth $4 mln.
newsitem.headline: Comptek unit gets contracts worth $4 mln.

text.p: Comptek Research Inc said Friday its defense electronics subsidiary, Comptek Federal Systems Inc, has been awarded two contracts valued at $4 million.
The first contract calls for CFS to provide its proprietary second generation Advance Multiple Environment Simulator (AMES II) System to a European NATO country.
The AMES II is an electronic warfare threat simulator capable of generating a complex radar threat environment.

The company said also that a smaller transportable version of the AMES II System, known as the Micro-AMES will be delivered to a subsidiary of Israel Aircraft Industries Ltd that produces electronic warfare avionics.
Comptek is a supplier of electronics and data communications systems for government and industry.
